title: EDA in Python with klib
description: The klib package can make EDA using Python easier and fun!
contents:
This post is a distillation of the klib posts found here and here. Both are Medium and might be behind a paywall for you. I discovered this package though colleagues at work who were using this for data cleaning and some EDA

The klib package is meant to make data cleaning, visualization and some EDA easier on pandas DataFrame objects. It provides a set of functions that can be gainfully utilized at the beginning of a data science project both for personal understanding and to provide visualizations of the data.
We will be using the msleep data from Râ€™s ggplot2 package. This can be accessed in Python as a pandas DataFrame using the rdatasets package.

import pandas as pd
from rdatasets import data
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import klib

msleep = data("ggplot2", "msleep")

Data quality: Missing values
You can create a heatmap of your data that looks at the missing value structure in your data. This is very useful for looking at the extent of missing data, missing data patterns, and some statistics that can help you judge whether you need to do something about missing data.

klib.missingval_plot(msleep);
plt.show()
